document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Gong, Lu, Tsaur, Shun-Chern, Zhu, Lin, An, Keying & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the subgenus Phortica (sensu stricto) (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia, with assessment of species delimitation using DNA barcodes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. MÃ¡ca (2003) identified
P . kukuanensis MÃ¡ca, 2003
from Taiwan as a new species based on the following characters: aedeagus subapically curved, basally less swollen and its apodeme being much longer; male abdominal sixth tergite extended on posterolateral corners. However, these characters are very common in
P . flexuosa
, even in the subgenus
Phortica
, such as
P . chi ( Toda & Sidorenko, 1996 )
,
P . eparmata ( Okada, 1977 )
,
P . eugamma ( Toda & Peng, 1990 )
, and
P . gamma ( Toda & Peng, 1990 )
.
